author: graymattr
title: Expand your diet
review:
Maybe this set doesn't need a review because it's completely self-explanatory by looking at the picture but I wanted to express that this is a wonderful set to have.  Have you ever bought a regular Lego set solely because it has one or three accessory elements that you wanted?  This set helps scratch that itch because you get all these food and kitchen elements.

This is a great value and has a nice variety of accessories.  I only bought one from the Lego store because it was the last one they had, otherwise I would have bought two or three to have a buffet.

Rating note: I rated the building experience as a 1 because there's no almost no building involved unless you count putting hotdogs in buns or connecting the ketchup, mustard and stove pieces together.  My rating isn't a demerit to the set, it's just not applicable.  The same is true for my playability rating since no child will play with a single Lego pretzel or banana for 30 minutes.  However, playability got a score since they enhance the play of Lego minifigures with the food pieces.
